isis.stitle: 2 SPEED AXLE SHIFT UNIT: EATON - AIR SHIFT SYSTEM - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubproc.title: Check for Air Leaks
svcsubproc.para: A simple method for quickly locating troubles in the system is to listen for possible air leaks and for sound which would indicate shift unit operation. Proceed as follows:

step1.para: Turn ignition switch ON to energize and open solenoid valve. Move shifter knob to HI. In this position, air pressure should be present in the entire system. Check for air leaks.
With shifter knob in LO, air pressure should be present only up to the shifter valve.
To check axle for shifting, operate shifter knob back and forth from LO to HI. If the shift unit is operating, a definite reaction will be evident by the sound of parts movement.
If air pressure is satisfactory and shift unit does not operate, disassemble and inspect shift unit.

svcsubproc.title: Check Pressure Switch
svcsubproc.para: In Low range, the pressure switch is closed. In High range, air pressure opens the pressure switch.
To check pressure switch operation, shift to High range and probe switch terminals. No voltage should be present. Replace a faulty pressure switch as an assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Check Electrical System (with Solenoid Valve)

step1.para: When ignition switch is ON, the solenoid valve is energized and air pressure is available to operate the system. When ignition switch is OFF, the solenoid valve is de-energized and exhausts the system, which downshifts the axle to Low range. Check wiring and circuit breaker for defects that would cause shorts or open circuits.
Make sure the valve has a good ground connection to the frame. With power at the valve, check operatIon as follows:
Disconnect lead wire and air line outlet at the valve and install air pressure gauge.

svcsubproc.para: Apply power to valve and observe air gauge reading. Operating pressure should be approximate reservoir pressure.
If gauge indicates approximate pressure, valve is okay.
If gauge indicates low or no pressure, valve is faulty. Replace valve assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Check Quick Release Valve
svcsubproc.para: The quick release valve provides a means of quickly exhausting air from the system when the axle is shifted from High to Low range.
To check valve operation, listen for audible air exhaust from the valve when the axle shifts from High to Low range. Replace a faulty quick release valve as an assembly.
